feed.title: Clashroyale - Esport News
feed.subtitle: RSS wrapper of Clashroyale inbox Esport News

entry.title: What's coming for CR Esports!
entry.content:
Welcome to the World of Clash Royale Esports!

Here, you’ll find the most relevant information about the competitive scene, what tournaments are coming up and past tournament information.

This article will be frequently updated. Make sure to come back so you don’t miss anything!

Upcoming tournaments

Get your decks ready, and don’t forget to sign up! Check out the upcoming tournaments here as they are announced.

Ongoing tournaments

Want to watch the world’s best players in action? Here’s where you will be able to find the ongoing tournaments supported by us!

Past tournaments

Below you’ll find some of the past tournaments where players battled for prize money, trophies, and glory!

CRL Warmup 2024

CRL Warmup brought together 14 of the CRL23 top players along with 10 players from 5 Qualifiers! The competition consisted of 3 stages: Open Qualifiers, a Double Round-Robin Group Stage, and a Double-elimination Final Bracket.

Format and rules here.

Participation is free and open to 16-year-old+ players.

Calalas Cup 2024

The Calalas Cup 2024 was a brand-new competition, giving players the chance to compete for the 15,000€ prize pool and earn points for the CRL24 Community Leaderboard!

Format: From April 19th to May 5th, the Calalas Cup was open for everyone to compete in and was divided into three phases. In phase 1 players were able to play 8 1000-player in-game qualifiers, with the top 4 players from each qualifier advancing to phase 2, the Group Stage. From there, the 32 qualified players were divided into 4 groups of 8 players competing in a single round-robin format, with the top 4 from each group advancing to the final phase, a 16-player bracket, awarding points for the CRL Community Leaderboard.

Participation criteria: You need to be 16 years old or older to participate.

GKR 2024 Solo

GKR 2024 brought a new individual format that was part of the CRL Community Tournaments Leaderboard, where players have the opportunity to accumulate points, with the player that finishes first winning the coveted Golden Ticket to the CRL24 World Finals!

Format: From July 22nd to the 29th, 16 open qualifiers were held, organized via the QLASH Community App, where the top 4 players from each qualifier moved on to phase 2, a 2-day event featuring a swiss bracket for each day, where the top 32 players from day 1 played a new swiss bracket until we got our top 16. The final phase was a 16-player double-elimination bracket awarding CRL community points and a share of the $16,625 prize pool

Participation criteria: You need to be 16 years old or older to participate.

LPL Clash Royale World Tour 2024

LPL World Tour 2024 was a 2-season competition contributing to the CRL Community Leaderboard.

Format: Each Season consisted of a Qualifier stage and 2 separate Finals, the Pro Division where the top 4 players from each qualifier played in a 16-player double-elimination bracket awarding CRL community points and a share of the $11,500 prize pool, and the Open Division, where the players that didn't reach the top 4 of the qualifiers played for a share of the $1,000 prize pool.

Participation criteria: You need to be 16 years old or older to participate.

Dragon League by QLASH

The QLASH App events reached the next level! We presented a new event that accompanied the players throughout the entire Clash Royale competitive season! From fiery Qualifiers to scorching hot Monthly Finals, the format reward skill and consistency, granting everyone the chance to compete for a share of the $30,000 prize pool and some exclusive Clash Royale League points for the community leaderboard!

Format: Starting April 1st, the Dragon League hosted 5 seasons, with a total of four stages, each leading to the Grand Final, later in the year. Starting in the Path of Dragon, players were able to play daily tournaments to gather points to the Dragon League Leaderboard. By placing in the top 96, these players along with 16 players from 2 Last Chance Qualifiers, qualified for the Dragon's Breath Tournament, a 128 double-elimination bracket where the top 16 players moved on to the Dragon League Monthly Final, playing a 16-player double-elimination bracket, which also awarded points for the CRL community leaderboard. The best 3 players of each Monthly Final had the chance to participate in a Grand Final event later in the year.

Participation criteria: You need to be 16 years old or older to participate.

BLAST Royale 2024

Blast Royale was an invite-only online tournament for Clash Royale where top players from around the globe went head-to-head to claim the title of ultimate champion.

Format: On October 12 and 13, the 8 invited players played in a crew battle format, getting divided into 2 teams of 4, with each team having a total of 16 lives. The winning crew was then placed in the upper bracket, while the loser team was placed in the lower bracket, determining our starting bracket this way. In this phase, players were no longer in teams and played against each other in a double-elimination bracket.

Clash Royale League 2024

CRL was back with another year of the highest level of competitive Clash Royale! Following 2023's format, 2024 brought you top-tier gameplay with Monthly Qualifiers, Golden Tickets, an in-person event, and more!

Format: Starting in April, the top 1000 players of the Path of Legends were able to face each other in Monthly Qualifiers until only 8 players remained. The top 8 players then moved to the Monthly Finals, with the winner receiving a Golden Ticket directly to the CRL World Finals. A total of 5 monthly competitions were played in-game via the Tournament Hub from April to August. The top player of the CRL24 Leaderboard, a player from China, and the top player from the Community Tournaments Leaderboard joined the 5 players that qualified through the Monthly Qualifiers. At the World Finals, these 8 players went head to head for the title of World Champion.

Mohamed Light won it all and is the 2024 Clash Royale League World Champion!

Participation criteria: You need to be 16 years old or older to participate in the CRL Monthly Qualifiers. Players must pass the fair play check, participate with clean accounts, and follow good sportsmanship.

We are always looking for people to collaborate with and are eager to help our community grow! So if you want to explore running a tournament, start by checking out our Community Tournament Guidelines and reach out to us by email at tournaments@supercell.com!

See you in the Arena!

- The Clash Royale Team

Apple is not a sponsor of, or responsible for conducting the promotions or events.

entry.title: CRL24: Everything you need to know!
entry.content:
Another year of the highest level of Clash Royale is right around the corner, and here’s all you need to know to take your shot and become the CRL24 World Champion!

A FIVE-MONTH JOURNEY. 8 GOLDEN TICKETS. 1 WORLD CHAMPION.

The Clash Royale League is more competitive than ever! With five monthly seasons from March until August, you’ll have five chances to win the title of Monthly Champion and a ticket to the CRL24 World Finals. Three more spots will be available through the CRL Leaderboard, the Community Tournaments Leaderboard, and a separate competition within China.

From PoL to Monthly Champion, let’s go over how you can get there!

START YOUR CLIMB IN THE PATH OF LEGENDS

The in-game rewards are nice, but let's move past that! Keep your eyes on that shiny gate, until you reach the prestigious “Ultimate Champion” League. From there, the true climb is ON! Build up your rating and move up the ladder until you see yourself in the Top 1000. If the season ends and your name is listed in there, congratulations, you are in the Monthly Qualifiers!

FROM 1000 TO 8: MONTHLY QUALIFIERS

You arrived at the Top 1000 of the Path of Legends, and you see that little icon appear on your main screen. This is the time for you to sign up through the Tournament Hub, which is also where the competition will be played. Put on your best gear and prepare for two intense days of battles in the Royale Arena! Check out how each day will be played:

Day 1: A 1000-player Swiss Bracket until 32 players remain.

Day 2: Players will be placed into one of 8 groups of 4 players each. Each player will play everyone in their group twice. The top player from each group will move on to the next stage and complete our lineup of 8 Monthly Finalists.

All battles will be played in the Duels format, with players receiving an invite for a single game. Once that game is over, players must edit their deck and accept the invite for the next battle.

THE MONTHLY FINAL

So, you made it! Welcome to the Monthly Final, where the eight best players from the Monthly Qualifiers will battle it out for the coveted title of Monthly Champion. In this stage, you’ll be placed in a double-elimination bracket, played in the Duels format, lasting 1 Day. Since you are already here, you might as well give it your all! But if you don’t make it to first place, don’t despair, as there are more ways to get your hands on a Golden Ticket!

WHAT ABOUT THE MONTHLY PRIZE POOL?

By reaching the Monthly Final, you will already take home a share of the $50,000 prize pool! Check out how the monthly prizing will be distributed.

GOLDEN TICKETS, COMPETITIVE POINTS, AND COMMUNITY TOURNAMENTS

Each monthly champion will be awarded a Golden Ticket, meaning they have their place reserved at the World Finals. But you will also be able to earn CRL Competitive Points during the Monthly Qualifiers. Here’s how the points will be distributed:

Monthly Qualifier:

  • Day 1 (Swiss): 5 points per win (up to 55)

  • Day 2 (Double Round Robin): 5 points per win (up to 30)

Monthly Final:

  • 1st place: 100 points

  • 2nd place: 80 points

  • 3rd place: 65 points

  • 4th place: 50 points

  • 5th-6th: 40 points

  • 7th-8th: 30 points

Keep playing and earning those points because if you finish Top 1 of the CRL Leaderboard, you guarantee yourself a Golden Ticket, marking your spot at the World Finals! 

But what is better than one leaderboard? Two leaderboards! This year, you can also get on the CRL World Finals road by playing community tournaments, as there will be a unique Community Leaderboard awarding the player who finishes 1st with a Golden Ticket. The tournament's awarding points will be announced soon. Until then, check out how the points will be distributed:

  • 1st place: 100 points

  • 2nd place: 80 points

  • 3rd place: 65 points

  • 4th place: 50 points

  • 5th-6th: 40 points

  • 7th-8th: 30 points

  • 9th-12th: 20 points

  • 13th-16th: 10 points

SUMMING IT ALL UP

Time to review all the ways and steps to win a Golden Ticket!

  • Monthly Seasons

    • Path of Legends: Finish within the Top 1000 to advance

    • Monthly Qualifiers: Signup in the Tournament Hub > Reach the top 32 of the Swiss Stage > Get 1st place of your group in the Double Round Robin

    • Monthly Final: Win in an 8-player double-elimination bracket

  • CRL Competitive Leaderboard: Finish 1st place by gathering points in the Monthly Seasons

  • Community Leaderboard: Finish 1st place by gathering points in Community Tournaments

  • China tournament: Win the separate China tournament. Only players residing within China will be eligible to participate

Important: You need to be at least 16 years old to participate in the CRL Monthly Qualifiers. Players must pass fair play checks, participate with clean accounts, and follow good sportsmanship.

You can read the full rulebook HERE!

MARK YOUR CALENDAR

Check out the full schedule for the CRL Monthly Qualifiers below.

April:

  • Path of Legends: March 4th - April 1st

  • Monthly Qualifiers: April 6th & 7th

  • Monthly Final: April 13th

May:

  • Path of Legends: April 1st - May 6th

  • Monthly Qualifiers: May 11th & 12th

  • Monthly Final: May 18th

June:

  • Path of Legends: May 6th - June 3rd

  • Monthly Qualifiers: June 8th & 9th

  • Monthly Final: June 15th

July:

  • Path of Legends: June 3rd - July 1st

  • Monthly Qualifiers: July 6th & 7th

  • Monthly Final: July 13th

August:

  • Path of Legends: July 1st - August 5th

  • Monthly Qualifiers: August 10th & 11th

  • Monthly Final: August 17th

Monthly Qualifiers start at 14:00 UTC and you can check-in between 11:30 and 13:30 UTC in the Tournament Hub. Monthly Final starts at 14:00 UTC.

As for the World Finals, they will take place in November, and all the information on the dates, location, and other details will be shared at a later date. Stay tuned and make sure to follow Clash Royale Esports on X and Instagram, and visit our Website to get all the latest updates!

See you in the Arena,

Clash Royale Esports

entry.title: CRL Community Tournaments: Everything you need to know!
entry.content:
The 2024 Clash Royale League year is underway, and it’s time we do a deep dive into this year’s CRL Community Tournaments and the CRL Community Points Leaderboard. Let’s get right into it!

As you might already know, there 8 ways to earn a Golden Ticket in #CRL24…

  • Winning one of the five CRL Monthly Finals 

  • Being the highest-placing Player on the CRL Points Leaderboard after the conclusion of the August Monthly Final

  • Winning the China Regional Tournament

  • And last, but not least, being the highest-placing Player on the CRL Community Points Leaderboard

The CRL Community Leaderboard tracks points that players earn in officially sanctioned community-organized tournaments. There will be a total of four community-organized tournaments during the #CRL24 year:

  • Dragon League by QLASH

  • Calalas cup

  • LPL Clash Royale World Tour 2024

  • GKR 2024 Solo

Let’s learn a bit more about these Community Tournaments…

Dragon League by QLASH

Dragon League by QLASH is a 5-season competition, running from April through September. Each season will award Community Leaderboard points to players who make it to the final “Phase” of each season. Each season will consist of three Phases, and the tournament format for each season is as follows:

  • Phase 1

    • Ladder Tournament, followed by…

    • 2 Last Chance Qualifiers

  • Phase 2

    • A 128-player Double Elimination Bracket

  • Phase 3

    • 16-player Double Elimination Bracket (awarding CRL Community Points)

You can learn more about the Dragon League by QLASH HERE!

Calalas Cup

The Calalas Cup is a 3-Phase tournament running from 19 April through 5 May. Players that advance to the third Phase will be awarded CRL Community Points. The tournament format is as follows:

  • Phase 1

    • In-game Qualifiers: 19 April - 21 April

  • Phase 2

    • 24-player Group Stage tournament: 25 April - 28 April

  • Phase 3

    • 16-player Final Bracket: 3 May - 5 May (awarding CRL Community Points)

You can learn more about the Calalas Cup HERE!

LPL Clash Royale World Tour 2024

LPL World Tour 2024 is a 2-season competition, with each Season having two Phases: Qualifiers & Finals. The tournament will be as follows:

  • Season 1:

    • Qualifiers: Dates to be confirmed

    • Finals: Dates to be confirmed (16-player Final Bracket, awarding CRL Community Points)

  • Season 2:

    • Qualifiers: Dates to be confirmed

    • Finals: Dates to be confirmed (16-player Final Bracket, awarding CRL Community Points)

GKR 2024 Solo:

GKR 2024 Solo is a 3-Phase tournament running from 22 July through 4 August. The tournament format is as follows…

  • Phase 1

    • Qualifiers: 22 July - 29 July

  • Phase 2

    • 64-player Swiss Tournament: 30 July - 31 July

  • Phase 3

    • 16-player Double Elimination bracket: 1 August - 4 August (awarding CRL Community Points)

CRL Community Points Leaderboard

See above for the CRL Community Points Leaderboard. This Leaderboard will be updated after the end of each Tournament (GKR 2024 Solo & Calalas Cup), or after the end of each Tournament’s Season (Dragon League by QLASH & LPL Clash Royale World Tour 2024).

As you may have noticed, the final Phase of each of the four CRL Community Tournaments culminates in a 16-player showdown, and the CRL Community Points Leaderboard shows a total of 16 slots. This is because the Top 16 finishers in each Community Tournament will be awarded points towards the CRL Community Leaderboard - the player with the highest placement, and thus, the most Points after the 4 Community Tournaments end, will earn themselves a Golden Ticket and a spot at the #CRL24 World Finals! See the Points breakdown for the Top 16 tournament finishers below:

  • 1st Place

    • 100 Points

  • 2nd Place

    • 80 Points

  • 3rd Place

    • 65 Points

  • 4th Place

    • 50 Points

  • 5th & 6th Place

    • 40 Points

  • 7th & 8th Place

    • 30 Points

  • 9th - 12th Place

    • 20 Points

  • 13th - 16th Place

    • 10 Points

Frequently Asked Questions

What happens if a tie occurs between multiple players on the Community Points Leaderboard after the final Community Tournament ends?

  • There will be a total of 3 tiebreakers in the case two or more players have the same amount of Community Points. Check out how the winner of the Golden Ticket will be determined below:

    • Tiebreaker 1: Player with the most total number of Community Tournament wins

    • Tiebreaker 2: Player with the most CRL Points (on the CRL Points Leaderboard)

    • Tiebreaker 3: Player with the highest average placement in all Path of Legends Race Seasons

Can a player win a Golden Ticket via the CRL Community Points Leaderboard if they have already won a Golden Ticket?

  • No. A player can only receive a Golden Ticket via the CRL Community Points Leaderboard if they have not already received a Golden ticket via a Monthly Finals or the CRL Points Leaderboard. If the player with the highest-placement on the Community Points Leaderboard has already received a Golden Ticket, the Golden Ticket will be awarded to the player with the next highest-placement

And you are all set!! Visit this article throughout the #CRL24 to know more on the CRL Community Tournaments and Leaderboard, and check out the 2024 Clash Royale League Ruleset for more information. Stay tuned and make sure to follow Clash Royale Esports on X and Instagram, and visit our Website to get all the latest updates!

See you in the Arena,

Clash Royale Esports

entry.title: SuperFEST 2024!
entry.content:
SuperFEST 2024 is coming!

Let’s talk about SuperFEST 2024! SuperFEST 2024 is a 3-day event that will host the World Finals of the Clash Royale League, Clash of Clans World Championship & Brawl Stars Championship. It is an in-person, live event that will take place in Helsinki, Finland, where fans can come watch their favorite players and teams fight for supremacy and for their claims as World Champions. As this is the first time that Clash of Clans, Clash Royale and Brawl Stars Esports will come together in one grand event, you’re not going to want to miss this!

SuperFEST 2024 will take place November 1 - 3! Check out the SuperFEST 2024 announcement video below…

📺 [EMBEDDED VIDEO]

All three events will be played across 3 days and the schedule is as follows…

Clash of Clans World Championship Finals:

  • Day 1: 10:00 - 13:00 EET

  • Day 2: 10:00 - 13:00 EET

  • Day 3: 10:00 - 13:00 EET

Clash Royale League World Finals: 

  • Day 1: 14:00 - 16:30 EET

  • Day 2: 14:00 - 16:30 EET

  • Day 3: 14:00 - 16:30 EET

Brawl Stars Championship Finals:

  • Day 1: 17:30 - 22:00 EET

  • Day 2: 17:30 - 21:30 EET

  • Day 3: 17:30 - 20:30 EET

Get your tickets now!

Don’t miss out on your opportunity to see history be made! Tickets for SuperFEST 2024 are on sale now - spots are limited, so make sure to secure your ticket as soon as you can! 

Tickets can be purchased here!

All the best clash action will be streamed on our event platform, so make sure to bookmark the Clash Royale Event Site! Set a reminder and grab your tickets now, and stay tuned for more information related to the Clash Royale League World Finals coming in the future. Make sure to follow Clash Royale Esports on X and Instagram, and visit our Website to get all the latest updates!

See you in the Arena,

Clash Royale Esports

entry.title: The 2024 World Finals are coming!
entry.content:
The 2024 Clash Royale League year has been a wild ride so far, and all 8 Golden Tickets have been awarded! The top Clash Royale competitors in the world have been battling it out throughout Monthly Competitions and Community tournaments to cement their spot at World Finals - and they haven’t disappointed! And now, it all comes down to one final showdown to see who the best player in the world is!

Let’s take a closer look at the tournament format...

The 2024 World Finals is a double-elimination bracket tournament, similar to this year’s Monthly Finals, taking place over three days: November 1 - 3. It will take place at SuperFEST, and will occur between the Clash of Clans World Championship Finals and the Brawl Stars Championship Finals on all 3 days. All three competition days will start at 14:00 EET and have a maximum of 5 matches on each day - make sure to take a look at the updated World Finals Ruleset and visit the SuperFEST Article to take a closer look at the SuperFEST schedule!

The Road to World Finals

Throughout the 2024 year, 8 Golden Tickets were up for grabs, signifying 8 available spots at World Finals: 5 Golden Tickets from the Monthly Finals tournaments, 1 Golden Ticket from the China Regional Tournament, 1 Golden Ticket from the CRL Points Leaderboard, and 1 Golden Ticket from the Community Leaderboard.

It’s been a wild and tight race to claim these Golden Tickets, but also without surprises in some areas! In the April, May and June Monthly Finals, Mohamed Light was dominant and took the top spot in all three competitions! He claimed the April Golden Ticket, with Taa and Pedro, the May and June runner-ups. Then the July Monthly Finals came along, and Lucas was able to knock Mohamed Light off of his pedestal! Lucas defeated Mohamed Light in the Grand Finals to end his Monthly Finals win streak and claim the fourth Golden Ticket of the year! In the last Monthly Finals of the year, the August Monthly Finals, two more Golden Tickets were claimed: Guriko claimed the August Monthly Finals, while CAL Sub secured enough points on the CRL Points Leaderboard to claim his Golden Ticket as well! In the China Regional Tournament, the Clash Royale League veteran LCIOP claimed his Golden Ticket and on the Community Tournaments Leaderboard, Ryley took the top spot with a margin of just 20 points!

With all 8 players locked in for the World Finals, it’s time to take a closer look at who will be competing…

The Competitors

Take a look at the 8 players who will be competing at the 2024 World Finals and show your support to who you want to see crowned World champion!

  • Mohamed Light

  • Taa

  • Pedro

  • Lucas

  • Guriko

  • Sub

  • Ryley

  • LCIOP

But that’s not all! Check out the starting bracket to see how they will stack up against each other in the first round!

Prize Pool

Let’s not forget about the $! The 2024 World Finals is the biggest competition of the year, and the prize pool reflects that - with $500,000 on the line, this is going to be an event to remember! Take a look at the prizing breakdown in the graphic below…

Where to Watch

The best place to watch the official broadcast of the World Finals is the Clash Royale Event Site! On the Event Site, you can choose between 8 different languages to watch - English, Spanish, Portuguese, French, Italian, German, Japanese and Korean! But that’s not all! By linking your Supercell ID, you can earn in-game rewards by making predictions and watching the match action live! Choose your language and check out the Event Site below…

  • English

  • Spanish

  • Portuguese

  • German

  • Italian

  • French

  • Japanese

  • Korean

And that’s it! Set a reminder, grab your popcorn, and lock in for the finale of #CRL24! Stay tuned and make sure to follow Clash Royale Esports on X and Instagram, and visit our Website to get all the latest updates!

See you in the Arena,

Clash Royale Esports

entry.title: CONGRATULATIONS TO THE 2024 WORLD CHAMPION - MOHAMED LIGHT!
entry.content:
The #CRL24 year has been a wild ride - Five monthly competitions, multiple Community Tournaments, epic showdowns on the CRL & Community points leaderboards, and a China Qualifier, all led to the World Finals at SuperFest! And now, after three days of the highest-level competitive Clash Royale action…

The 2024 Clash Royale League World Champion has been crowned!

Mohamed Light has been DOMINANT throughout the 2024 year! In his first three Monthly Finals appearances, he took the top spot, claiming his Golden Ticket and a spot at World Finals in April and retaining his top spot for three months straight! He continued to be a top contender throughout the year - whether it be his second place finishes in the July and August Monthly Finals, first place finishes in the multiple Dragon League and LPL World Tour 2024 Seasons, or securing the top spots on the #CRL24 Points & Community Leaderboards, Mohamed Light was unstoppable!

And then we arrived at the 2024 Clash Royale League World Finals! After dropping only a single game to LCIOP in the first round, he went on to go undefeated against OS Lucas and Ryley in the upper bracket to claim the World Finals trophy. With an impressive record of eight wins and only one loss over three days, there is only one player who deserves the title of WORLD CHAMPION!

Mohamed Light has claimed the World Finals trophy and largest share of the $500,000 prize pool!

Rewatch the epic three-day showdown of Mohamed Light’s road to World Champion!

📺 [EMBEDDED VIDEO] 📺 [EMBEDDED VIDEO] 📺 [EMBEDDED VIDEO]

A HUGE thank you and congratulations to all players who competed throughout the #CRL24 year - and, of course, to the fans who have been following their journeys as well! The conclusion of the World Finals at SuperFest wraps up the year! Stay tuned to the Clash Royale in-game Esports tab, Clash Royale Esports on X, Instagram, and Website to learn more about future plans and to make sure you're up-to-date on everything #CRL related!

See you in the Arena,

Clash Royale Esports
